verses.verse: Concerning the Ammonites,<WH1121> <WH5984> thus<WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD;<WH3068> Hath Israel<WH3478> no<WH369> sons?<WH1121> hath he no<WH369> heir?<WH3423> why<WH4069> then doth their king<WH4428> inherit<WH3423> <WH853> Gad,<WH1410> and his people<WH5971> dwell<WH3427> in his cities?<WH5892>

Therefore, <WH3651> behold,<WH2009> the days<WH3117> come,<WH935> saith<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> that I will cause an alarm<WH8643> of war<WH4421> to be heard<WH8085> in<WH413> Rabbah<WH7237> of the Ammonites;<WH1121> <WH5983> and it shall be<WH1961> a desolate<WH8077> heap,<WH8510> and her daughters<WH1323> shall be burned<WH3341> with fire:<WH784> then shall Israel<WH3478> be heir<WH3423> unto them that were<WH853> his heirs,<WH3423> saith<WH5002> the LORD.<WH3068>

Howl, <WH3213> O Heshbon,<WH2809> for<WH3588> Ai<WH5857> is spoiled:<WH7703> cry,<WH6817> ye daughters<WH1323> of Rabbah,<WH7237> gird<WH2296> you with sackcloth;<WH8242> lament,<WH5594> and run to and fro<WH7751> by the hedges;<WH1448> for<WH3588> their king<WH4428> shall go<WH1980> into captivity,<WH1473> and his priests<WH3548> and his princes<WH8269> together.<WH3162>

Wherefore <WH4100> gloriest<WH1984> thou in the valleys,<WH6010> thy flowing<WH2100> valley,<WH6010> O backsliding<WH7728> daughter?<WH1323> that trusted<WH982> in her treasures,<WH214> saying, Who<WH4310> shall come<WH935> unto<WH413> me?

Behold, <WH2009> I will bring<WH935> a fear<WH6343> upon<WH5921> thee, saith<WH5002> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069> of hosts,<WH6635> from all<WH4480> <WH3605> those that be about<WH5439> thee; and ye shall be driven out<WH5080> every man<WH376> right forth;<WH6440> and none<WH369> shall gather up<WH6908> him that wandereth.<WH5074>
And afterward<WH310> <WH3651> I will bring again<WH7725> <WH853> the captivity<WH7622> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon,<WH5983> saith<WH5002> the LORD.<WH3068>

Concerning Edom,<WH123> thus<WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts;<WH6635> Is wisdom<WH2451> no<WH369> more<WH5750> in Teman?<WH8487> is counsel<WH6098> perished<WH6> from the prudent?<WH4480> <WH995> is their wisdom<WH2451> vanished?<WH5628>

Flee <WH5127> ye, turn back,<WH6437> dwell<WH3427> deep,<WH6009> O inhabitants<WH3427> of Dedan;<WH1719> for<WH3588> I will bring<WH935> the calamity<WH343> of Esau<WH6215> upon<WH5921> him, the time<WH6256> that I will visit<WH6485> him.

If <WH518> grape gatherers<WH1219> come<WH935> to thee, would they not<WH3808> leave<WH7604> some gleaning grapes?<WH5955> if<WH518> thieves<WH1590> by night,<WH3915> they will destroy<WH7843> till they have enough.<WH1767>

But <WH3588> I<WH589> have made<WH853> Esau<WH6215> bare,<WH2834> I have uncovered<WH1540> <WH853> his secret places,<WH4565> and he shall not<WH3808> be able<WH3201> to hide himself:<WH2247> his seed<WH2233> is spoiled,<WH7703> and his brethren,<WH251> and his neighbors,<WH7934> and he is not.<WH369>
Leave <WH5800> thy fatherless children,<WH3490> I<WH589> will preserve them alive;<WH2421> and let thy widows<WH490> trust<WH982> in<WH5921> me.

For <WH3588> thus<WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD;<WH3068> Behold,<WH2009> they whose<WH834> judgment<WH4941> was not<WH369> to drink<WH8354> of the cup<WH3563> have assuredly drunken;<WH8354> <WH8354> and art thou<WH859> he<WH1931> that shall altogether go unpunished?<WH5352> <WH5352> thou shalt not<WH3808> go unpunished,<WH5352> but<WH3588> thou shalt surely drink<WH8354> <WH8354> of it.

For <WH3588> I have sworn<WH7650> by myself, saith<WH5002> the LORD,<WH3068> that<WH3588> Bozrah<WH1224> shall become<WH1961> a desolation,<WH8047> a reproach,<WH2781> a waste,<WH2721> and a curse;<WH7045> and all<WH3605> the cities<WH5892> thereof shall be<WH1961> perpetual<WH5769> wastes.<WH2723>

I have heard<WH8085> a rumor<WH8052> from<WH4480> <WH854> the LORD,<WH3068> and an ambassador<WH6735> is sent<WH7971> unto the heathen,<WH1471> saying, Gather ye together,<WH6908> and come<WH935> against<WH5921> her, and rise up<WH6965> to the battle.<WH4421>
For, <WH3588> lo,<WH2009> I will make<WH5414> thee small<WH6996> among the heathen,<WH1471> and despised<WH959> among men.<WH120>

Thy terribleness<WH8606> hath deceived<WH5377> thee, and the pride<WH2087> of thine heart,<WH3820> O thou that dwellest<WH7931> in the clefts<WH2288> of the rock,<WH5553> that holdest<WH8610> the height<WH4791> of the hill:<WH1389> though<WH3588> thou shouldest make thy nest<WH7064> as high<WH1361> as the eagle,<WH5404> I will bring thee down<WH3381> from thence,<WH4480> <WH8033> saith<WH5002> the LORD.<WH3068>

Also Edom<WH123> shall be<WH1961> a desolation:<WH8047> every one<WH3605> that goeth<WH5674> by<WH5921> it shall be astonished,<WH8074> and shall hiss<WH8319> at<WH5921> all<WH3605> the plagues<WH4347> thereof.

As in the overthrow<WH4114> of Sodom<WH5467> and Gomorrah<WH6017> and the neighbor<WH7934> cities thereof, saith<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> no<WH3808> man<WH376> shall abide<WH3427> there,<WH8033> neither<WH3808> shall a son<WH1121> of man<WH120> dwell<WH1481> in it.

Behold, <WH2009> he shall come up<WH5927> like a lion<WH738> from the swelling<WH4480> <WH1347> of Jordan<WH3383> against<WH413> the habitation<WH5116> of the strong:<WH386> but<WH3588> I will suddenly<WH7280> make him run away<WH7323> from<WH4480> <WH5921> her: and who<WH4310> is a chosen<WH977> man, that I may appoint<WH6485> over<WH413> her? for<WH3588> who<WH4310> is like me?<WH3644> and who<WH4310> will appoint<WH3259> me the time? and who<WH4310> is that<WH2088> shepherd<WH7462> that<WH834> will stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> me?

Therefore <WH3651> hear<WH8085> the counsel<WH6098> of the LORD,<WH3068> that<WH834> he hath taken<WH3289> against<WH413> Edom;<WH123> and his purposes,<WH4284> that<WH834> he hath purposed<WH2803> against<WH413> the inhabitants<WH3427> of Teman:<WH8487> Surely<WH518> <WH3808> the least<WH6810> of the flock<WH6629> shall draw them out:<WH5498> surely<WH518> <WH3808> he shall make their habitations<WH5116> desolate<WH8074> with<WH5921> them.
The earth<WH776> is moved<WH7493> at the noise<WH4480> <WH6963> of their fall,<WH5307> at the cry<WH6818> the noise<WH6963> thereof was heard<WH8085> in the Red<WH5488> sea.<WH3220>

Behold, <WH2009> he shall come up<WH5927> and fly<WH1675> as the eagle,<WH5404> and spread<WH6566> his wings<WH3671> over<WH5921> Bozrah:<WH1224> and at that<WH1931> day<WH3117> shall the heart<WH3820> of the mighty men<WH1368> of Edom<WH123> be<WH1961> as the heart<WH3820> of a woman<WH802> in her pangs.<WH6887>

Concerning Damascus.<WH1834> Hamath<WH2574> is confounded,<WH954> and Arpad:<WH774> for<WH3588> they have heard<WH8085> evil<WH7451> tidings:<WH8052> they are fainthearted;<WH4127> there is sorrow<WH1674> on the sea;<WH3220> it cannot<WH3808> <WH3201> be quiet.<WH8252>

Damascus <WH1834> is waxed feeble,<WH7503> and turneth herself<WH6437> to flee,<WH5127> and fear<WH7374> hath seized<WH2388> on her: anguish<WH6869> and sorrows<WH2256> have taken<WH270> her, as a woman in travail.<WH3205>
How <WH349> is the city<WH5892> of praise<WH8416> not<WH3808> left,<WH5800> the city<WH7151> of my joy!<WH4885>

Therefore <WH3651> her young men<WH970> shall fall<WH5307> in her streets,<WH7339> and all<WH3605> the men<WH376> of war<WH4421> shall be cut off<WH1826> in that<WH1931> day,<WH3117> saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts.<WH6635>
And I will kindle<WH3341> a fire<WH784> in the wall<WH2346> of Damascus,<WH1834> and it shall consume<WH398> the palaces<WH759> of Ben-hadad.<WH1130>

Concerning Kedar,<WH6938> and concerning the kingdoms<WH4467> of Hazor,<WH2674> which<WH834> Nebuchadnezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> shall smite,<WH5221> thus<WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD;<WH3068> Arise<WH6965> ye, go up<WH5927> to<WH413> Kedar,<WH6938> and spoil<WH7703> <WH853> the men<WH1121> of the east.<WH6924>

Their tents<WH168> and their flocks<WH6629> shall they take away:<WH3947> they shall take<WH5375> to themselves their curtains,<WH3407> and all<WH3605> their vessels,<WH3627> and their camels;<WH1581> and they shall cry<WH7121> unto<WH5921> them, Fear<WH4032> is on every side.<WH4480> <WH5439>

Flee, <WH5127> get<WH5110> you far off,<WH3966> dwell<WH3427> deep,<WH6009> O ye inhabitants<WH3427> of Hazor,<WH2674> saith<WH5002> the LORD;<WH3068> for<WH3588> Nebuchadnezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> hath taken<WH3289> counsel<WH6098> against<WH5921> you, and hath conceived<WH2803> a purpose<WH4284> against<WH5921> you.

Arise, <WH6965> get you up<WH5927> unto<WH413> the wealthy<WH7961> nation,<WH1471> that dwelleth<WH3427> without care,<WH983> saith<WH5002> the LORD,<WH3068> which have neither<WH3808> gates<WH1817> nor<WH3808> bars,<WH1280> which dwell<WH7931> alone.<WH910>

And their camels<WH1581> shall be<WH1961> a booty,<WH957> and the multitude<WH1995> of their cattle<WH4735> a spoil:<WH7998> and I will scatter<WH2219> into all<WH3605> winds<WH7307> them that are in the utmost<WH7112> corners;<WH6285> and I will bring<WH935> <WH853> their calamity<WH343> from all<WH4480> <WH3605> sides<WH5676> thereof, saith<WH5002> the LORD.<WH3068>

And Hazor<WH2674> shall be<WH1961> a dwelling<WH4583> for dragons,<WH8577> and a desolation<WH8077> forever:<WH5704> <WH5769> there shall no<WH3808> man<WH376> abide<WH3427> there,<WH8033> nor<WH3808> any son<WH1121> of man<WH120> dwell<WH1481> in it.

The word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> that<WH834> came<WH1961> to<WH413> Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> against<WH413> Elam<WH5867> in the beginning<WH7225> of the reign<WH4438> of Zedekiah<WH6667> king<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> saying,<WH559>
Thus <WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts;<WH6635> Behold,<WH2009> I will break<WH7665> <WH853> the bow<WH7198> of Elam,<WH5867> the chief<WH7225> of their might.<WH1369>

And upon<WH413> Elam<WH5867> will I bring<WH935> the four<WH702> winds<WH7307> from the four<WH4480> <WH702> quarters<WH7098> of heaven,<WH8064> and will scatter<WH2219> them toward all<WH3605> those<WH428> winds;<WH7307> and there shall be<WH1961> no<WH3808> nation<WH1471> whither<WH834> <WH8033> the outcasts<WH5080> of Elam<WH5867> shall not<WH3808> come.<WH935>

For I will cause<WH853> Elam<WH5867> to be dismayed<WH2865> before<WH6440> their enemies,<WH341> and before<WH6440> them that seek<WH1245> their life:<WH5315> and I will bring<WH935> evil<WH7451> upon<WH5921> them, even<WH853> my fierce<WH2740> anger,<WH639> saith<WH5002> the LORD;<WH3068> and I will send<WH7971> <WH853> the sword<WH2719> after<WH310> them, till<WH5704> I have consumed<WH3615> them:
And I will set<WH7760> my throne<WH3678> in Elam,<WH5867> and will destroy<WH6> from thence<WH4480> <WH8033> the king<WH4428> and the princes,<WH8269> saith<WH5002> the LORD.<WH3068>
But it shall come to pass<WH1961> in the latter<WH319> days,<WH3117> that I will bring again<WH7725> <WH853> the captivity<WH7622> of Elam,<WH5867> saith<WH5002> the LORD.<WH3068>
